answers.answer: No way on the indigestion angle. There are so many causes of eye pain that it is mere speculation to hazard a cause. You should see an Eye MD physician (ophthalmologist) to establish a diagnosis.JCH III MD
Hi ,I have been having the same symptoms for the past 5 days. Did you figure out what was wrong?

After taking mefenamic acid it would eventually relieve the apin until the next night. See an Eye MD ophthalmologist. Find one near you at www.aao.orgdJCH MD

Hi, i have had Type1 Diabetes for 27 years now and for the last day my eye's have been painful when i have to look up or strain them! I have noticed red lines appearing in both eye's and some blood vessels on the top of my eyelid (where i would place my eyeshadow)Obviously, i am going to speak to my speacialist about this, but i would like to know what he is maybe going to tell me so i can prepare myself.Thank you

question: Hi,I have been having pain in my right eyeball for the past 2 days. I have been having this sometime before(not requent though,may be when I had severe fever and so on). It aches when I try to move my eyeballs or strains when i try to see somethign through my right corner.What can be the reason for this? Some people say this might also be associated to indigestion. Is this true?
title: Right Eyeball pain
